required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: FreeO2 PreHospital - Automated Oxygen Titration vs Manual Titration According to the BLS-PCS
clinical_study.official_title: Automated Administration of Oxygen (FreeO2) in Ambulances for COPD and Trauma Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of automated oxygen titration in comparison with manual adjustment in ambulance.

detailed_description.textblock:
It's a single center study in Canada.
This will be a single centred prehospital multi-period cluster crossover feasibility trial, (see Figure 2a) enrolling patients in Ottawa, Ontario, who are treated by paramedics from the Ottawa Paramedic Service, who have been trained in the use of the automated oxygen delivery device. We will be using the FreeO2 device. Patients requiring oxygen therapy during prehospital transportation will be enrolled. No randomization will occur within this single centred feasibility study
Patients requiring oxygen therapy during the prehospital transportation will be enrolled and will be included as soon as they are placed into the ambulance, until the arrival of the vehicle to a hospital.
Each patient will be randomized into one of two groups according to the usual oxygen therapy or oxygen therapy protocol with the automated system FreeO2.
In both groups, SpO2 will be collected continuously every second FreeO2 monitoring, in addition to the collection of vital signs carried out by the staff according to the standards.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This will be a single centred prehospital multi-period cluster crossover feasibility trial

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of the study design - REB approval
primary_outcome.time_frame: Date of REB submission to date of REB approval, target: until 3 months (90 days) from REB submission
primary_outcome.description: Time to REB approval for single site time to REB approval for single site define by below 3 months (90 days) from REB submission, time to readiness to initiate the clinical trial after REB approval - below 3 months (90 days) from REB approval, evaluation of data collection tool - 100% of data captured in >90% case at hospital discharge (until day 28), Survey responses from Paramedics - At the end of the transportation day

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of the study design - initiate the clinical trial
primary_outcome.time_frame: Target until 3 months (90 days) from REB approval
primary_outcome.description: Time to readiness to initiate the clinical trial

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of the study design - Evaluation of data collection tool
primary_outcome.description: target: 100% of data captured in >90% cases

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of the study design - study protocol compliance
primary_outcome.description: Target of 80% of compliance for protocol intervention/control group

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of the study design - Paramedics survey
primary_outcome.description: A survey will be complete by Paramedics at the end of day of transportation (day 1); the target response rate is 75% of case.

secondary_outcome.measure: Oxygenation - Total Time in the target zone SpO2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 - During prehospital transportation (from entry in the ambulance until exit of the ambulance)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of time spent in the target zone SpO2 90±2% in the COPD population (in the range of 88 to 92%) 94±2% in the trauma population (in the range of 92 to 96%)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 - During prehospital transportation (from entry in the ambulance until exit of the ambulance)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of time spent in thyperoxia (SpO2 > 94% in COPD patients and SpO2 >98% in trauma patients)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 - During prehospital transportation (from entry in the ambulance until exit of the ambulance)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of time spent in the target zone SpO2 - % of time with hypoxemia (SpO2<86% in COPD patients and SpO2 <90% in trauma patients)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1- On The first ABG or capillary blood gases after hospital admission
secondary_outcome.description: -Evaluation of level of PaCO2 on the first ABG at ED or ICU admission (when available)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1- On The first ABG or capillary blood gases after hospital admission
secondary_outcome.description: -Evaluation of the rate of respiratory acidosis (pH<7.35 and PaCO2>45mmHg) after hospital admission

secondary_outcome.measure: The rate of patients without oxygen at the end of the transportation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 - At the end of the transportation (at the exit from the ambulance)
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of patient weaned of oxygen at the end of the transportation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During hospital stay - approximately 28 days - admission day until hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of NIV use during lenght of stay in hospital

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During hospital stay- approximately 28 days - admission day until hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of ICU admission during lenght of stay in hospital

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During hospital stay - hospital admission through study completion average 28 days or until death if occured
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of death during lenght of stay in hospital

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Length of hospital stay measured in calendar days, hospital admission through study completion, average 28 days
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of the hospital length of stay

secondary_outcome.measure: The oxygen consumption during the pre-hospital transport
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 - During prehospital transportation (from entry in the ambulance until exit of the ambulance),
secondary_outcome.description: Mean O2 flow rate (total O2 consumption) during transportation

arm_group.description: In this group, the - usual care based upon BLS-PCS with manual titration of oxygen. In this group the SpO2 was recorded any time with FreeO2 device - recording mode.
The adjustment of the oxygen flow will be made by the FreeO2 system, an automated titration to reach the SpO2 target set by clinician.

intervention.description: The adjustment of the oxygen flow will be made by the FreeO2 system, an automated titration of oxygen flow every second to reach the SpO2 target. The SpO2 target will be set at 90% in COPD patients and 94% in trauma patients.
The flow of oxygen will be administered according to the usual protocol during the transport and until transfer to the emergency departement.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
COPD patient:
1. Known or suspected acute exacerbation of COPD. Acute exacerbation is defined by worsening of the respiratory condition for less than 2 weeks. Suspected COPD is defined by patients of at least 30 years old with respiratory symptoms with a past or current smoking history of at least 10 pack years, or
2. Able to measure SpO2 via pulse oximetry
Trauma patient:
I) Trauma: patients who sustain any trauma (minor or major), II) Able to measure SpO2 via pulse oximetry
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inclusion in another study not allowing the co-enrollment
- Pregnancy
- Age <18 years
- Prehospital Invasive or non-invasive mechanical ventilation
